title: Sakanwa
author: Sakanwa
created_time: July 22, 2023, 04:27:45 PMLast edit: July 22, 2023, 04:50:23 PM by Sakanwa
content: Is there anyone that can offer me a $60 USDT loan and I will pay $110 in one month please.I will be glad if there is anyone to help process this for me as it is very urgent

comments.author: Eternad
comments.body: Providing sign message on the Bitcoin wallet address that you use before in the forum will make this loan request attractive to lenders. @Shasan is the most active lender here in the forum which you can get a quick loan with your offered interest rate. You earned enough merit and enrolled to signature campaign which can give you a plus to acquire loan.Ask directly on his thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5030169.0 for a quick loan.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: Eternad on July 22, 2023, 04:36:48 PMProviding sign message on the Bitcoin wallet address that you use before in the forum will make this loan request attractive to lenders. The account created in 2021 which means all the merits are earned and it's hard now a days to earn merits. I think it's okay to lend this user a $60. But OP, on the title it's $60 but in the topic you are asking for $100. Which is the correct amount?

comments.author: CYBER_COWBOY
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on July 22, 2023, 04:40:33 PMQuote from: Eternad on July 22, 2023, 04:36:48 PMProviding sign message on the Bitcoin wallet address that you use before in the forum will make this loan request attractive to lenders. The account created in 2021 which means all the merits are earned and it's hard now a days to earn merits. I think it's okay to lend this user a $60. But OP, on the title it's $60 but in the topic you are asking for $100. Which is the correct amount?OP also PM,ed me before and asked if he could lend $50.OP if you want to borrow 60$ I can help you with 10% interest, but unfortunately I can only lend out BTC.If not I agree with @Eternad that @Sashan is the best lender to use.

comments.author: Eternad
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on July 22, 2023, 04:40:33 PMQuote from: Eternad on July 22, 2023, 04:36:48 PMProviding sign message on the Bitcoin wallet address that you use before in the forum will make this loan request attractive to lenders. The account created in 2021 which means all the merits are earned and it's hard now a days to earn merits. I think it's okay to lend this user a $60. But OP, on the title it's $60 but in the topic you are asking for $100. Which is the correct amount?With the case of peanutswar recently which his account is high rank that earned enough merits too, I think we should start making sign message as a must for taking a loan since the account might be  hacked without a trace. I’m not accusing OP is hacked right now but he has no record of loan history on hist trust page and it’s better to play safe. Actually I mention on my post that has enough merit to be considered for a loan grant.
